newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Target up after bid.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Target up after bid.

text.p: Target Therapeutics Inc shares were actively bought up preceding Tuesday's market open on news it will be acquired by Boston Scientific Corp for about $70 per share in Boston Scientific stock.
Before the opening bell, Target climbed to 67 per share, up from Monday's last Nasdaq trade of 59 while Boston Scientific fell to 65-1/2 from 66-7/8.
Before the deal was announced after Monday's market close, Target shares soared 12-1/4.
The companies valued the transaction at $1.1 billion and said they expect it to close in the second quarter of 1997.

Boeing Co shares traded 1-1/2 higher to 108 after the aircraft manufacturer announced late yesterday that market conditions do not support ongoing development of a larger version of Boeing's 747 jumbo jet.
Boeing said it instead plans to focus attention on developing new versions of its 767 and 777 twin-engine jets.

InPhyNet Medical Management Inc shares were bid up to 25-1/5 from 22-3/4 at Monday's Nasdaq close, an increase driven by MedPartners Inc agreement to acquire the company for the equivalent of about $28.70 per share in MedPartners stock.
Nellcor Puritan Bennett Inc shares were weakened early Tuesday by its reporting this morning lower-than-expected quarterly earnings, traders said.
The stock fell three to 20-3/4 after announcing a loss of $0.06 per share after a $0.26 per share merger-related charge versus $0.30 one year ago.
"They came in at $0.20 (per share on an operating basis), but the Street was looking for $0.30 (per share)," a trader said.
According to Zack's Investment Research, the analysts' consensus estimate for the quarter ended last month was $0.31 per share.
Synopsys Inc shares rose to 44-1/4 from 43-3/8 after reporting last night earnings of $0.38 per share, $0.04 above the Zack's consensus esatimate and $0.10 better than the year-ago results.
